servinfo.title: Compressor Assembly Removal and Installation (M16A Model)

ptxt.intxrefpoff: Compressor Assembly On-Vehicle Inspection:M16A, J20A and F9Q Model

s1.ptxt: Run engine at idle with A/C ON for 10 minutes.
Recover refrigerant from the A/C system using recovery and recycling equipment referring to “Recovery” in Operation Procedure for Charging A/C with Refrigerant:M16A, J20A and F9Q Model .

attention3.ptxt: The amount of compressor oil at removed must be measured and the same amount must be poured when installing the compressor.

s1.ptxt: Disconnect suction and discharge hoses from compressor.

attention3.ptxt: Cap open fitting immediately to keep moisture out of system.

s1.ptxt: Remove compressor with clutch assembly from its mount.

attention3.ptxt: If compressor assembly is replaced with one, drain oil from compressor. Then, measure its amount.

servinfosub.title: Installation

attention2.ptxt: Be sure to use HFC-134a (R-134a) compressor oil.

servinfosub.ptxt: Reverse removal procedure noting the following instructions.

item.ptxt: If compressor is replaced, pour new compressor oil.
Evacuate and charge the A/C system referring to “Evacuation” and “Charge” in Operation Procedure for Charging A/C with Refrigerant:M16A, J20A and F9Q Model .

torqueitem.t-part: Compressor mounting bolt for M16 engine model
